<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// A set of enums which specify the assigned numeric values for known llvm</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// calling conventions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// LLVM Calling Convention Representation</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// The default llvm calling convention, compatible with C. This convention</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// is the only one that supports varargs calls. As with typical C calling</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// conventions, the callee/caller have to tolerate certain amounts of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// prototype mismatch.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafd841a49aec1539bc88abc8ff9e170fb"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafd841a49aec1539bc88abc8ff9e170fb">C</a> = 0,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Generic LLVM calling conventions. None of these support varargs calls,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and all assume that the caller and callee prototype exactly match.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Attempts to make calls as fast as possible (e.g. by passing things in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// registers).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cabc8e2ee40a84687a9e12fd08784b87ba"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cabc8e2ee40a84687a9e12fd08784b87ba">Fast</a> = 8,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Attempts to make code in the caller as efficient as possible under the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// assumption that the call is not commonly executed. As such, these calls</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// often preserve all registers so that the call does not break any live</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// ranges in the caller side.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca94ec9273479164e4aec1d5d91b71dc85"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca94ec9273479164e4aec1d5d91b71dc85">Cold</a> = 9,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Used by the Glasgow Haskell Compiler (GHC).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca8e8dc64aad833bd23d07d3384522575e"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca8e8dc64aad833bd23d07d3384522575e">GHC</a> = 10,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Used by the High-Performance Erlang Compiler (HiPE).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca20ddc463f96d806f369d56205ea205f5"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca20ddc463f96d806f369d56205ea205f5">HiPE</a> = 11,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// OBSOLETED - Used for stack based JavaScript calls</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca4f42667edde6e9cb80cfae6361e5e76a"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca4f42667edde6e9cb80cfae6361e5e76a">AnyReg</a> = 13,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Attemps to make calls as fast as possible while guaranteeing that tail</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// call optimization can always be performed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cad6e9c0ff694f0fca0222e79e772b647e"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cad6e9c0ff694f0fca0222e79e772b647e">Tail</a> = 18,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Special calling convention on Windows for calling the Control Guard</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Check ICall funtion. The function takes exactly one argument (address of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// the target function) passed in the first argument register, and has no</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// return value. All register values are preserved.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca3f8227288993442d6f4a0bb234c9bc5b"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca3f8227288993442d6f4a0bb234c9bc5b">CFGuard&#95;Check</a> = 19,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// This follows the Swift calling convention in how arguments are passed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// but guarantees tail calls will be made by making the callee clean up</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// their stack.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// stdcall is mostly used by the Win32 API. It is basically the same as the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// C convention with the difference in that the callee is responsible for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// popping the arguments from the stack.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4caa88ccf4313b5bc700dec76fd9bc5d40e"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4caa88ccf4313b5bc700dec76fd9bc5d40e">X86&#95;StdCall</a> = 64,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// &#39;fast&#39; analog of X86&#95;StdCall. Passes first two arguments in ECX:EDX</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// registers, others - via stack. Callee is responsible for stack cleaning.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cae60325da71f0576e18cc0e5dd7e8afb6"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cae60325da71f0576e18cc0e5dd7e8afb6">PTX&#95;Kernel</a> = 71,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Call to a PTX device function. Passes all arguments in register or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// parameter space.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca9b03ea185599539f24eb1f467627c111"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca9b03ea185599539f24eb1f467627c111">PTX&#95;Device</a> = 72,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Used for SPIR non-kernel device functions. No lowering or expansion of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// arguments. Structures are passed as a pointer to a struct with the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// byval attribute. Functions can only call SPIR&#95;FUNC and SPIR&#95;KERNEL</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// functions. Functions can only have zero or one return values. Variable</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// arguments are not allowed, except for printf. How arguments/return</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// values are lowered are not specified. Functions are only visible to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// devices.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4caacadec9c4ef27d184bcbbea409afebb2"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4caacadec9c4ef27d184bcbbea409afebb2">SPIR&#95;FUNC</a> = 75,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Used for SPIR kernel functions. Inherits the restrictions of SPIR&#95;FUNC,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// except it cannot have non-void return values, it cannot have variable</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// arguments, it can also be called by the host or it is externally</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// visible.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca9b5e79699935bf721647d44339701860"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca9b5e79699935bf721647d44339701860">SPIR&#95;KERNEL</a> = 76,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Used for Intel OpenCL built-ins.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cad47327c131a0990283111588b89587cb"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cad47327c131a0990283111588b89587cb">Intel&#95;OCL&#95;BI</a> = 77,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// The C convention as specified in the x86-64 supplement to the System V</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// ABI, used on most non-Windows systems.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca10f11fb587acddab17f3ad85eb698fbe"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca10f11fb587acddab17f3ad85eb698fbe">X86&#95;64&#95;SysV</a> = 78,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// The C convention as implemented on Windows/x86-64 and AArch64. It</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// differs from the more common \\c X86&#95;64&#95;SysV convention in a number of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// ways, most notably in that XMM registers used to pass arguments are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// shadowed by GPRs, and vice versa. On AArch64, this is identical to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// normal C (AAPCS) calling convention for normal functions, but floats are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// passed in integer registers to variadic functions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cae41511c1ad4197da36cef403f34bac72"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cae41511c1ad4197da36cef403f34bac72">Win64</a> = 79,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// MSVC calling convention that passes vectors and vector aggregates in SSE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// registers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cacfa4cc9bcdaefd5e969c258c994052b9"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cacfa4cc9bcdaefd5e969c258c994052b9">X86&#95;VectorCall</a> = 80,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Placeholders for HHVM calling conventions (deprecated, removed).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca51dcc0bcdca1d5609b0ec4b43c0d9971"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca51dcc0bcdca1d5609b0ec4b43c0d9971">DUMMY&#95;HHVM</a> = 81,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cad710a26c741142a91059eff051990185"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cad710a26c741142a91059eff051990185">DUMMY&#95;HHVM&#95;C</a> = 82,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// x86 hardware interrupt context. Callee may take one or two parameters,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// where the 1st represents a pointer to hardware context frame and the 2nd</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// represents hardware error code, the presence of the later depends on the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// interrupt vector taken. Valid for both 32- and 64-bit subtargets.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca765508a953368531a7d69d1279e6cfb1"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca765508a953368531a7d69d1279e6cfb1">X86&#95;INTR</a> = 83,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Used for AVR interrupt routines.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca44deee0b3babbda0be6f27856afaacf9"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca44deee0b3babbda0be6f27856afaacf9">AVR&#95;INTR</a> = 84,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Used for AVR signal routines.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Used for special AVR rtlib functions which have an &quot;optimized&quot;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca8ddc8eecc1584438b45d1d45fc8b87ae"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca8ddc8eecc1584438b45d1d45fc8b87ae">AVR&#95;BUILTIN</a> = 86,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Used for Mesa vertex shaders, or AMDPAL last shader stage before</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca1a9f243b16678fc294567b72bbe87223"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca1a9f243b16678fc294567b72bbe87223">AMDGPU&#95;VS</a> = 87,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Used for Mesa/AMDPAL geometry shaders.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Used for special MSP430 rtlib functions which have an &quot;optimized&quot;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca1be5f33158d1f92c70edc260fdd7fc3c"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca1be5f33158d1f92c70edc260fdd7fc3c">MSP430&#95;BUILTIN</a> = 94,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Used for AMDPAL vertex shader if tessellation is in use.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Used for AMDPAL shader stage before geometry shader if geometry is in</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cad61318e853e529ac703f52a853efa1d1"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cad61318e853e529ac703f52a853efa1d1">AMDGPU&#95;ES</a> = 96,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// For emscripten &#95;&#95;invoke&#95;&#42; functions. The first argument is required to</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Used for M68k interrupt routines.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca19e10cbfb07e93e0a7e40cca2faff4c0"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca19e10cbfb07e93e0a7e40cca2faff4c0">M68k&#95;INTR</a> = 101,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Preserve X0-X13, X19-X29, SP, Z0-Z31, P0-P15.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca7c23dce1e95fc36e9d2c168f9e036cc7"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca7c23dce1e95fc36e9d2c168f9e036cc7">AArch64&#95;SME&#95;ABI&#95;Support&#95;Routines&#95;PreserveMost&#95;From&#95;X0</a> = 102,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Preserve X2-X15, X19-X29, SP, Z0-Z31, P0-P15.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca72069ecfe852db0ea1f10c1549989424"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca72069ecfe852db0ea1f10c1549989424">AArch64&#95;SME&#95;ABI&#95;Support&#95;Routines&#95;PreserveMost&#95;From&#95;X2</a> = 103,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Used on AMDGPUs to give the middle-end more control over argument</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// placement.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca8d298f27ddf40e08cd5aacea9837784f"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca8d298f27ddf40e08cd5aacea9837784f">AMDGPU&#95;CS&#95;Chain</a> = 104,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Used on AMDGPUs to give the middle-end more control over argument</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// placement. Preserves active lane values for input VGPRs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca521c5b7a44a8222c814379b57481aec9"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca521c5b7a44a8222c814379b57481aec9">AMDGPU&#95;CS&#95;ChainPreserve</a> = 105,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Used for M68k rtd-based CC (similar to X86&#39;s stdcall).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafb7645aeee7db3640bbfdad799b4cfe9"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafb7645aeee7db3640bbfdad799b4cfe9">M68k&#95;RTD</a> = 106,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Used by GraalVM. Two additional registers are reserved.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cae9c6786f93f1d156d2b40ecc6be438bb"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cae9c6786f93f1d156d2b40ecc6be438bb">GRAAL</a> = 107,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Calling convention used in the ARM64EC ABI to implement calls between</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// x64 code and thunks. This is basically the x64 calling convention using</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// ARM64 register names. The first parameter is mapped to x9.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4caf80cc3a71c40926e6c35a60ccdc6428e"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4caf80cc3a71c40926e6c35a60ccdc6428e">ARM64EC&#95;Thunk&#95;X64</a> = 108,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Calling convention used in the ARM64EC ABI to implement calls between</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// ARM64 code and thunks. This is just the ARM64 calling convention,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// except that the first parameter is mapped to x9.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca047fefb5017b2873eb2e88f1a27fb14a"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca047fefb5017b2873eb2e88f1a27fb14a">ARM64EC&#95;Thunk&#95;Native</a> = 109,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Calling convention used for RISC-V V-extension.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca12164937f88e72c8b59ca563c70187e0"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca12164937f88e72c8b59ca563c70187e0">RISCV&#95;VectorCall</a> = 110,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Preserve X1-X15, X19-X29, SP, Z0-Z31, P0-P15.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca963e14ac38d6e3b63f8e37085702951c"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca963e14ac38d6e3b63f8e37085702951c">AArch64&#95;SME&#95;ABI&#95;Support&#95;Routines&#95;PreserveMost&#95;From&#95;X1</a> = 111,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// The highest possible ID. Must be some 2^k - 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca2f101663d054cffa9c9956f30e7ecf7d"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca2f101663d054cffa9c9956f30e7ecf7d">MaxID</a> = 1023</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// end namespace CallingConv</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// end namespace llvm</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// LLVM&#95;IR&#95;CALLINGCONV&#95;H</span></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>
